contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[File:Bovenmerwede.jpg|thumb]] The '''Boven Merwede''' is a stretch of river in the [[Netherlands]]. The [[Afgedamde Maas river]] joins the [[Waal (river)|Waal]] at [[Woudrichem]] to form the Boven Merwede, which at [[Hardinxveld-Giessendam]] splits into the [[Beneden Merwede river]] on the right and the [[Nieuwe Merwede river]] on the left. Its length is 8.8 km. The [[Merwede]] is part of the main shipping route between [[Rotterdam]] and [[Germany]]. There is a road bridge, from the west side of [[Gorinchem]] on the north to the west side of [[Werkendam|Sleeuwijk]] on the south. There are three passenger ferries. <gallery> [[Image:Bovenmerwede.jpg|Merwedebrug over the Boven Merwede near [[Gorinchem]]]] </gallery> {{Coord|51|49|42|N|4|56|15|E|display=title|region:NL}} {{Rhine–Meuse–Scheldt delta}} [[Category:Rivers of the Netherlands]] [[Category:Rhine–Meuse–Scheldt delta]] [[Category:Distributaries]] {{SouthHolland-geo-stub}} {{NorthBrabant-geo-stub}}
